result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul N. Dietz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Paul N. Dietz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Paul N. Dietz was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 9:17am
State appears by ADA Ralph Uttke;  Deft appears with Atty Peter Rotter.

Ct. 1 Possession of THC>> dismissed

COURT grants above
PLEA:
Ct. 2 Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> GUILTY

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: Pay $100 fine plus court costs, includes DNA surcharge and sample.

C: Br. 1

AMENDED.  No contact with J.B. or N.F.C.-unless allowed by dept of SS. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Absolute sobriety or unless has a valid prescription for meds.  Defendant to report to Wausau Health Services for drug testing instead of ATTIC reporting.
